intro: Ruellia amplectens, commonly known as the silverleaf ruellia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring heart-shaped leaves with a silvery underside. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of blue or purple, which bloom from spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Ruellia amplectens is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and flowering habit.
